Des: <prosody rate="slow">Did you know that the marathon distance was not always 42.195 kilometers?</prosody> Originally, it was about 40 kilometers.<break time="0.3s"/> However, during the 1908 London Olympics, the starting line was placed in Windsor Castle's gardens so the royal family could witness the start, while the finish line was set in front of the royal box in the Olympic stadium.<break time="0.4s"/> This extension led to the official marathon distance of <prosody pitch="+1st">42.195 kilometers,</prosody> which was formally established by World Athletics in 1921.<break time="0.5s"/>
SubDes:
Did you know that the marathon distance was not always 42.195 kilometers? Originally, it was about 40 kilometers. 
However, during the 1908 London Olympics, 
the starting line was placed in Windsor Castle's gardens so the royal family could witness the start, 
while the finish line was set in front of the royal box in the Olympic stadium. 
This extension led to the official marathon distance of 42.195 kilometers, 
which was formally established by World Athletics in 1921.

Des: <prosody rate="medium">Now, let's talk about a legendary runner:</prosody> <prosody pitch="+1st">Abebe Bikila</prosody> from Ethiopia.<break time="0.3s"/> In the 1960 Rome Olympics, he won the marathon gold medal <prosody pitch="+2st">running barefoot,</prosody> becoming the first African Olympic champion in history.<break time="0.4s"/> Four years later, in Tokyo 1964, he defended his title—this time, wearing shoes—becoming the <emphasis level="strong">first-ever back-to-back Olympic marathon winner.</emphasis><break time="0.5s"/>
SubDes:
Now, let's talk about a legendary runner: Abebe Bikila from Ethiopia. 
In the 1960 Rome Olympics, 
he won the marathon gold medal running barefoot, 
becoming the first African Olympic champion in history. 
Four years later, in Tokyo 1964, 
he defended his title—this time, wearing shoes—becoming the first-ever back-to-back Olympic marathon winner.

SubDes:
And that's a wrap! Who impressed you the most in today's race?
